botauth.description: Here you can manage your bots auth-token: it's required to communicate with Twitch Chat and APIs. The access will be valid as long as you don't change the password or revoke the apps permission in your bot account.
directives: Open an incognito-tab or different browser, you are not logged into Twitch or are logged in with your bot account
Open the copied URL, sign in with the bot account and accept the permissions
You will see a message containing the authorized account. If this account is wrong, just start over, the token will be overwritten.
botauth.heading: Updating Bot-Authorization

channel.permissionIntro: In order to access non-public information as channel-point redemptions or take actions limited to the channel owner the bot needs additional permissions. The owner of the channel needs to grant those!
permissionIntroBullets: Select permissions on the left side
Pass the URL to the channel owner and tell them to open it with their personal account logged in
The bot will display a message containing the updated account
channel.permissionStart: For #{channel} the bot should be able to…

table.titleAllPermissions: Bot can use all available extra features
table.titleNoPermissions: Bot can not use features aside of chatting
table.titlePartialPermissions: Bot can use some extra features

changelog.fullLink: See full changelog in [History.md](https://github.com/Luzifer/twitch-bot/blob/master/History.md) on Github
